Job Description:
USDM Life Sciences Overview

USDM Life Sciences provides a variety of IT and compliance solutions to help life sciences companies streamline laboratory, clinical and manufacturing operations while staying in compliance with FDA regulations. USDM disrupts convention and delivers compliance with proficiency, simplicity, and efficiency to achieve better results for our customers that are in the business of saving lives. It’s a place where you can make an impact in the world as a champion for life sciences innovation and also get the experience and mentoring to grow your career.

Founded in Santa Barbara, California in 1999 by two UCSB graduates, USDM has grown to a global company with offices throughout the US, Toronto, Canada and Frankfurt, Germany.

The Sr Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting PDM (Pharmaceutical Development and Manufacturing) department’s greater use of data in reporting, analytics, visualizations, and obtaining insights. They will be responsible for helping a team of data scientists, developers and analysts develop analytic tools and apply data sciences techniques to continue to improve our knowledge management, perform predictive analytics, and identify trends in scientific and operational datasets. Furthermore, they will drive artificial intelligence and machine learning projects throughout PDM to uncover patterns, correlations, and new insights in data that would otherwise be difficult to do due to large data volumes and data in various systems with different data models and structures.
 
Qualifications/Required Skills
•    Ability to interact with the business and technical teams to gather requirements, finalize and obtain sign-off from the stakeholders and support the technical teams during the entire lifecycle of the project
•    Ensure all application functionalities designed are implemented and delivered within the timelines
•    Track and manage progress of work, manage escalations and ensure the delivery of Business process management and application
•    Expertise crafting use cases, user stories, requirements and design specifications using agile methodology
•    Experience working with a development team to create dashboards in visualizations tools like Tableau, Spotfire, R Shiny, Django, Qlickview etc.
•    Strong awareness and market knowledge of Advanced Analytics & Data Science
•    Ability to produce reports and track progress of the team and other reporting needs on the project
 
Qualifications
 
•    Bachelor’s degree in Biology, Business, Information Systems or related field
•    Overall 10+ years’ experience in Pharmaceutical Supply Chain
                Disclaimer: This job description is intended to describe the general nature and the level of the work being performed by the people assigned to this position. It is not intended to include every job duty and responsibility specific to the position. USDM Life Sciences reserves the right to amend and change responsibilities to meet business and organizational needs as necessary.
USDM Life Sciences is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to their protected veteran, disabled, or any other protected status.
Company Description: Transformation and Innovation in Regulatory Compliance and Technology Life Sciences consulting firm with over 20 years experience in global compliance and technology. We offer bold solutions that accelerate innovation and compliance. Our team of subject-matter experts includes former FDA auditors and regulatory officials whose insight and oversight are part of every project. We have over 2 decades of experience working with hundreds of life sciences companies, enabling them to maintain compliance, optimize business operations, and reduce costs.

Location: Minneapolis, MN
Duration: Fulltime
 Description:
AI Governance aims to realize organizational value through focusing on effective and efficient analytic process to build & usage of analytic capabilities & solutions. It focuses on the process of consuming & deriving insights from data rather than the creation and storage of data.
The AI Governance role drives discovery, execution and standards around operational analytic governance. The AI governance role will provide leadership, strategic decision making and guidance within analytic governance included partnering with the technical executional resource to understand and solve unique and complex problems as well as partnering with the broader organization to ensure best practice sharing & adherence of standards. You will interface with the Global Data Governance organization to ensure consistency across Data & Analytic Governance where applicable as well as have a stance on the appropriate technologies to support Analytic Governance to realize our technical & commercial teams’ needs.
 In this role, Candidate will:
- Design end to end analytic framework, including overall architecture, capabilities, platforms, tools & governing processes
- Establish & define metrics around gauging analytic health of organization
- Consult & communicate positioning/go-forward strategies for analytic governance tools/capabilities
- Communicate governance standards & framework to ensure alignment to enterprise guidelines for security, auditability, data governance, metadata management, etc.
- Define/improve governance best practices, guidelines & integration with enterprise solutions
- Review analytic solutions for re-usability, scalability, synergy opportunities & alignment to defined best practices & guidelines
- Monitor technology trends & participates in discovery of any new tools/capabilities of interest
- Benchmark Analytic Governance with Industry analysts and other companies
- Lead Analytic Governance committee/steering team to ensure cross-functional exposure & adherence
- Bachelor’s degree
- 10 years demonstrating a high degree of proficiency in designing and developing complex, high-quality analytic solutions
- 5 or more years in an Analytic Governance role process-mapping, detailed frameworks, best practices and governance guidelines
- A proven track record of delivering scalable, resource intensive, integrated and operational analytic solution; Experience creating roadmaps & process diagrams
- Hands-on experience working with enterprise scale data projects including Big Data, Data Science & BI Reporting
- Experience in Agile Development, with specific Solution Architect preferred (understanding of end-to-end implementation of a technology Solution)
- Ability to phase the delivery of analytic solutions such that it can meet immediate needs, while building towards the long-term strategic solution
- Strong communication skills with ability to communicate complex technical concepts in a digestible way
- Ability to effortlessly switch gears from summary view for leadership to hands-on discussion with practitioners
 Nice to Have:

Job Description:
Overview
PK currently has an exciting opportunity for a Production Engineer that would like to join our team as a full-time employee in Denver, CO.  
Responsibilities
Performing “hand off” duties when a release is defined and ready for testing/release. The Production engineer will coordinate with testing team(s) to make sure the testing group understands what’s in the new build to make sure everything gets tested.
Constantly monitor our data analytics systems looking for trends (good or bad) and getting ahead of any issues by creating tickets and supporting those tickets through triage. Sometimes, the production engineer will work directly with the developers to make sure that the issue is well understood and ready for work.
Working closely with our Tech lead to ensure that upcoming releases are ready for production using testing results, analytics data to make sure regressions don’t make it to production.
This person will still write code, but that won’t be their primary duty.
This job perfect for someone that knows well how to code, but is also interested in DevOPS/Data Science and is looking for a place to apply both skillsets.
Qualifications
Must have knowledge in experimentation
Must have experience in gitlab
Good to have knowledge or understanding of front-end application development life cycle
Must have good communication skills
Good to have release management experience
Good to have experience in data science
Good to have experience in SWIFT development
Must have experience in creating dashboards using tableau and kibana
Must have experience in crashlytics tools like firebase or fabric
Able to multi-task

Job Description:
In this role, the IT Project Manager/ Scrum Master will be responsible for initiation and managing of IT Project/Product Scrum teams to support their global business in a dynamic environment. A successful candidate would leverage effective Agile/SCRUM practices working collaboratively with business and cross functional teams while delivering quality, with more frequent deployments leveraging Lean methods with continuous learning and improvements.

Responsibilities and Duties:
Determine product features, Epic work closely with Product Managers, prepare product roadmap, dependencies, budget and release strategy aligning to Digital Marketing priorities
Actively collaborate with the stakeholders in a consultative role eliciting business and technical User Stories and help prioritize backlog to MVP guidelines
Facilitate Agile ceremonies for daily stand up, sprint planning, backlog grooming, retrospectives while effectively meeting business goals and improving team velocity.
Effectively utilize the Agile methodologies, implement BDD/TDD and other CI/CD approach for DevOps, utilize JIRA, Confluence and other collaboration tools for increased productivity.
Lead team to resolve all program/project issues and impediments on a timely manner, effectively communicate, manage expectations and resolve conflicts working closely with team and leadership.
Build and execute operational and technical project plans, facilitate all project gate reviews, utilize PPM tool and effectively escalate issues to meet the project milestones/goals.
Align to business and IT priorities by effectively leveraging Agile/ SCRUM SAFe methodologies, while coaching and mentoring team members.
Manage multiple product Scrum teams (internal, external, & for multiple divisions) in parallel, with regular standups, promoting team collaboration, innovation and quality outcomes.
Actively manage backlog aligning to business priorities, identify risks and impediments, prioritize conflicting needs, handle matters expeditiously and proactively, follow-through on tasks to successful completion with minimal guidance, often with deadline pressures.
Provide regular status update to the Leadership and Management team with constant drive to make improvements to the outcomes.
Demonstrate high adaptability and flexibility to take responsibility to support new projects that has priority and as communicated.
Basic Qualifications
Minimum 7 years of experience as IT project manager with minimum 3 years' experience as Agile Scrum Master preferably in Data Analytics/Science projects.
Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, Information Technology or 10 years' experience in Information Technology projects.
Certified in Agile/SAFe (CSM) methodology

Preferred Experience and Skills:
Experience as Application Project Manager/Scrum Master leading multiple Scrum teams supporting business transformation.
Experience in Business Intelligence, Data Science and Data Engineering working with different business and product teams,
Experience in Agile/Scrum methodologies, facilitating the ceremonies like backlog grooming, epic /User story, daily standups, estimation and velocity, resolving impediments, sprint retrospection, coaching team members and usage of JIRA, Confluence and metrics reporting.
Strong communicator with effective presentation skills delivering formal presentations & facilitate Demo to various levels of management articulating project/Sprint status, risk mitigations, benefits & financial realizations.
Familiarity with the DevOps implementation focusing on the Continuous Integration and deployment leveraging automation building deployment pipelines with focus on quality and speed to market.
Self-motivated and independent critical thinker who can visualize and guide team during conflicting situations to stay focused on business goals & priorities
Has strong experience in Agile SAFe methodologies, Kanban, Scrum of Scrums, lean budget, managing release train, process improvements, provide training on Agile tools & dashboard.
Effective conflict & impediments management in a fast-paced environment, take higher responsibilities working with cross functional team who are working on multiple priorities
Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills with ability to influence stakeholders and team members with variety of personal styles to focus on right priorities under pressure and tight deadlines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills is a must.

etc.

customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.

centers and AWS regions.

environment.

Company Description:
We are R&D problem solvers providing independent, premier services to government and industry clients. Our multidisciplinary nature allows us to rapidly assemble diverse teams to tackle problems from multiple directions. We push the boundaries of science and technology to develop innovative solutions that advance the state of the art and improve human health and safety. Operating as a nonprofit since our 1947 inception, we work in the public’s best interest and toward the betterment of mankind.  At SwRI, we tirelessly pursue innovation and excellence in science and technology for the betterment of humankind. We support work on nearly 4,000 client projects at any given time through a wide range of technical competencies with 2,574 staff members in nine technical divisions. Client services include, but are not limited to, Automotive and Transportation, Biomedical & Health, Chemistry & Materials, Computers and Electronics, Defense & Security, Earth & Space, Energy & Environment, and Manufacturing & Construction. 
TECHNICAL DIVISIONS
Applied Physics-Developing advanced electronic and microelectronic devices, power supplies, voice and data communication systems, robot test services, and payloads
Applied Power-Using physical science research and applied engineering to produce sensors, instruments, and hardware used worldwide.
Center for Nuclear Waste Regulatory Analyses-Resolving technical and regulatory issues related to a potential geologic repository for spent nuclear fule and high-level radioactive waste.
Chemistry and Chemical Engineering-Performing research and technical services using chemistry and chemical engineering technology.
Defense and & Intelligence Solutions-Providing advanced direction finding and tracking systems through geolocation system development.
Fuels and Lubricants Research-Performing fuels and lubricants research activities to meet regulatory and competitive goals.
Intelligent Systems-Providing engineering services in resaerch and development of complex systems and equipment.
Mechanical Engineering-Improving safety, reliability, efficiency and life of new or existing mechanical components or systems.
Powertrain Engineering-Designing and developing vehicle and engine components to achieve performance and emissions goals.
Space Science & Engineering-Developing and managing advanced scientific payloads aboard satellites and sounding rockets.
PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE
Innovation in science and technology has been a hallmark of Southwest Research Institute since its earliest days. It's no exaggeration to say we are committed to advancing science and applying technology to benefit government, industry, and all humankind. That is our mission. Our multidisciplinary, collaborative approach allows us to successfully solve clients' most challenging problems. Today, we are a leader among independent, nonprofit research and development organizations. Our staff of 2,574 scientists, engineers, analysts, and support staff members continues to accomplish outstanding fundamental and applied engineering and research for clients from diverse segments of government and industry. Adam L. Hamilton, P.E, President and CEO
IN THE COMMUNITY
Our staff is expert at developing solutions that help build a better tomorrow today; and that practical, innovative spirit carries through to our community interactions. Staff members generously donate time and outher resources to support food drives, blood drives, and other
outreach programs. 
HONORS AND AWARDS
Southwest Research Institute has earned 43 R&D 100 awards since 1971. Each year R&D Magazine recognizes developments regarded as among the 100 most significant technical accomplishments. The Chicago Tribune dubbed the program "the Oscars of Invention".

Job Description:
Job Description
Creates and revises complex technical documentation to support the marketing, operation, repair, and maintenance of company products.

Company Description:
In 1959, Robert Underwood took over what was then a floundering, debt-ridden staffing company, with the mission of finding the right candidates for its customers. Renaming it Amtec Engineering, Inc., Bob worked hard to pull the company out of the red and honor his predecessor’s debts. With God’s help and a lot of elbow grease, he succeeded, and the little staffing agency company grew under the leadership of Bob and a new partner, Peter Van Dyken.
At first located on Commonwealth Avenue in Fullerton, California, the company served mainly technical companies like Beckman, General Dynamics, Honeywell, and Rockwell. Without the invention of computers or fax machines, candidates hand-delivered or mailed in their time cards and resumes, which were coded and painstakingly filed so they could be retrieved for the right direct hire or contract job. Each week, many contractors came in to pick up their checks, and they were always greeted by name.

Job Description:
Describe the job and feel free to add expected Role and Responsibilities
VSolvit is seeking an Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO) to support the U.S. Army - Dugway Proving Ground West Desert Test Center (WDTC) Data Sciences Division (DSD) IT Support Contract. The ISSO will be a self-starter with a willingness to learn. Responsibilities include ensuring appropriate operational security posture is maintained for specific information systems; developing and updating system security plans; managing and controlling changes to specific systems and assessing the security impact of those changes. These also include incident handling and development of information system security documentation, policies and procedures. Additionally, the ISSO will assist in the evaluation of security solutions to ensure they meet security requirements for processing classified information. Finally, the ISSO will need to be intimately familiar with the U.S. Army’s Risk Management Framework (RMF) processes and procedures.
Job Description
Provide technical expertise for Cybersecurity efforts supporting multiple programs and labs
Prepare DoD RMF accreditation packages solutions for Test Mission Support System (TMSS) systems
Analyze and translate Cybersecurity and technical solutions into accreditation packages that meets DoD/Army accreditation standards.
Perform Cybersecurity analysis of all aspects of both operational information systems and laboratory-based information systems
Provide continuous monitoring to maintain the security posture of program resources
Implement and maintain vendor-supplied security software packages, work with security hardware components, perform diagnostics for security problems and identify and analyze security risks
Perform vulnerability scans and work with systems administrators to identify and implement technical security controls
Write security-related procedures, incident reports and white papers
Create and maintain all required Cybersecurity RMF artifacts
Assist customers with filling out necessary paperwork for access to TMSS network
Maintain the Army Tracking & Certification Tracking System (ATCTS) for WDTC users
  Basic Qualifications
US Citizenship
Active DoD SECRET Security Clearance or the ability to get one
Required Skillset: Microsoft Excel, Adobe Acrobat Pro
Minimum of ONE qualifying baseline certification: Security+ CE, CISM, CISSP (or Associate), CAP, CASP CE
1+ years' working with of U.S. Military information system accreditation processes
1+ years' of implementation and operation of mandatory tools such as Assured Compliance Assessment Solutions (ACAS), Security Center, Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP), Compliance Checker (SCC), and DISA Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs)
1+ years' experience with Nessus Vulnerability Scanner

Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in an IT field
Strong background in Linux or Windows Server and Active Directory
DoD 8500.2, ACAS, NESSUS Pro, Security Compliance Checker, Security Technical Implementation Guides, and DISA Security Readiness Review
Ability to create professional reports for system owners and technical staff that accurately describes test events and results
Company Summary:
Join the VSolvit Team! Founded in 2006, VSolvit (pronounced 'We Solve It') provides geospatial and information technology consulting services and solutions to government and private section clients. VSolvit is an award winning 8(m)/EDWOSB, SBA-certified 8(a)/SDB, and a certified HUBZone company. We offer Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance, as well as 401K Retirement Plan options, Tuition Reimbursement, and other benefits. Our goal is to grow together and enjoy the work that we do as a team.
VSolvit LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Company Description: VSolvit (pronounced: "We.Solve.it") is an award-winning Woman owned, technology services provider that specializes in cybersecurity, cloud computing, geographic information systems (GIS), business intelligence (BI) systems, data warehousing, geographic information systems (GIS), engineering services, custom database and application development, administrative services, project/program management, and predictive analytics. VSolvit serves clients such as the Department of Defense (DOD), the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD), and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. Our custom technology solutions for federal and health industry clients and partners have won awards for innovation, been launched from the U.S. White House, and are being used to solve complex problems ranging from improving national security to optimizing vaccine supply chains to breast cancer screening and treatment programs.

Job Description:
The Senior Manager, Advertising Analytics will support internal stakeholders through quantitative analytics relating to digital advertising operations. This will include reporting and analysis, developing data visualizations and interactive dashboards, assisting in the development of enterprise data platform, and supporting business decisions with data-driven insight.
Key Responsibilities:
Work with various stakeholder groups, including Sales, Ad Operations, Finance, Product and Technology to understand business objectives and inform advertising analytics learning agenda
Create and maintain weekly and monthly reports for measuring performance; conduct ad hoc and deep dive analyses to derive insights and recommendations
Assist in the development of KPIs, automated interactive dashboards, and forecasting models for advertising business
Partner with Data Technology to manage requirements, data collection, data quality, structuring, and blending of data from multiple tools and sources in enterprise data platform to meet analytical needs
Leverage data to guide Sales and Strategy Leadership to maximize inventory yield and to achieve annual revenue targets across owned and 3rd party platforms
Partner with other Data Analytics teams and shared resources to produce collaborative strategic insights
Essential Qualifications:
Bachelor degree with analytical focus (e.g., business administration, marketing, statistics, economics, engineering, computer science, etc.)
Minimum of 4-5 years’ work experience in a data analytics and/or data science role (for/with a digital publisher, agency, or ad technology company preferred)
Solid understanding of the fundamentals of digital advertising including ad sales, ad operations, ad serving technology, inventory yield, and revenue optimization
Proficiency in analyzing and interpreting data from platforms such as DFP and Google Analytics; experience with YouTube Analytics preferred
Highly Proficient in SQL (e.g. Redshift, BigQuery)
Experience with Business Intelligence and Visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Qlik)
Proficiency in building, maintaining, and validating Excel reports and models
Ability to synthesize complex qualitative and quantitative data and communicate relevant insights and recommendations using data visualization
Strong organizational skills; ability to handle multiple concurrent projects and work independently
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate clearly and confidently with internal stakeholders
Other Relevant Experience (a plus):
Consumer web/mobile, online/mobile gaming, social, and/or OTT content analytics experience
Experience with social media platform analytics/APIs, DMP platforms and/or digital 3rd party measurement tools (e.g., comScore, Nielsen, Dynamic Logic)
Experience with statistical and/or big data programming languages such as R, Python, Hive, Spark, SPSS, SAS
Basic technical knowledge of Coding/HTML (e.g., to help QA ads and ad tagging)
Company Description: For more than two decades, Harvey Nash has been providing businesses around the globe with the high-caliber IT recruiting, IT outsourcing/offshoring and executive search solutions that connect them with the talented IT professionals they need to perform, grow and compete.

Job Description:
Essential Job Duties:

The Edward P. Fitts Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering at North Carolina State University invites applications and nominations for the Dopaco, Inc. Distinguished Professorship. The Dopaco Professorship is endowed, having a salary level in the upper range for distinguished full professors at the university as well as a significant annual operating budget. We are especially seeking applicants with expertise in more than one discipline or domain relevant to ISE at NC State or with strengths in emerging areas such as data science and other areas related to ISE.

Other Work/Responsibilities:



Minimum Experience/Education:

Candidates are expected to have an earned doctorate degree in Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Computer Science, Statistics, Manufacturing Engineering, or a related field.

Departmental Required Skills:

Candidates should possess excellent teaching skills and an ability to conduct research programs supportive of the Department interest. Excellent verbal and writing skills are required.

Preferred Experience, Skills, Training/Education:

N/A

Necessary Licenses or Certifications:

N/A

About the Department/Unit:

The Edward P. Fitts Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering is one of only five named industrial and systems engineering departments in the United States and is consistently ranked among the top programs in the country. The department currently has a rich and diverse research portfolio in teaching and research in advanced manufacturing, biomedical manufacturing, health systems, human-systems, logistics, production systems, and systems analysis and optimization. The department houses two state funded centers, including: The Ergonomics Center of North Carolina (www.theergonomicscenter.com), which is the only center of its kind at a U.S. public research institution, and the Center for Additive Manufacturing and Logistics (camal.ncsu.edu), which is one of the most advanced manufacturing and 3D printing laboratories in the country. The department also supports two other academic programs within the university, including Operations Research (www.or.ncsu.edu) and Integrated Manufacturing Systems Engineering (www.imsei.ncsu.edu). ISE will be joining other engineering departments in NC State’s university/industry research campus (centennial.ncsu.edu) in Summer 2020. Our location in Raleigh, NC, represents the eastern point of the Research Triangle and places us close to three major universities, a large number of world-class companies, and several leading research institutes. To learn more about the department, prospective applicants are encouraged to speak with ISE faculty and visit our departmental website (www.ise.ncsu.edu) for more detailed information.

AA/EEO:

NC State University is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, genetic information, status as an individual with a disability, or status as a protected veteran.

If you have general questions about the application process, you may contact Human Resources at (919) 515-2135 or workatncstate@ncsu.edu Individuals with disabilities requiring disability-related accommodations in the application and interview process, please call 919-515-3148.

Final candidates are subject to criminal & sex offender background checks. Some vacancies also require credit or motor vehicle checks. If highest degree is from an institution outside of the U.S., final candidates are required to have their degree equivalency verified at www.wes.org or equivalent service. Degree(s) must be obtained prior to start date in order to meet qualifications and receive credit.

NC State University participates in E-Verify. Federal law requires all employers to verify the identity and employment eligibility of all persons hired to work in the United States. To apply, please go to https://jobs.ncsu.edu/postings /

The Company has recognized data as a strategic asset and our ability to manage and mine our data as a strategic capability and competitive advantage for the company. In this technology space, new and unique approaches to data management are emerging and advancing rapidly. These emerging technologies enable greater insights than ever before that drive business management and product growth capabilities, consumer innovation and personalization capabilities.
As part of the Studio’s Technology team you’ll be joining a group of seasoned, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting and dynamic industry.
Your mission is to provide an interoperable and governed data ecosystem which brings us closer to the consumer, makes us more efficient and enables Studio businesses to transform data into value. This role will be responsible to define and execute on both the Studios traditional BI requirements and an evolving consumer data strategy '. 'You will be responsible for providing senior technical leadership and strategic technical direction for The Company Studios Data Services team. You will partner with business leaders, software architects, and Studio executives to develop a data platform strategy that aligns with the enterprise architecture framework and modernizes the portfolio, while optimizing the Total Cost of Ownership. You will be responsible for the development, communication and ongoing governance of architecture planning, roadmaps, principles, standards and reference architectures to promote consistent data solutions across Studio Technology.
To do this successfully, you will need to have experience with solution architecture, data governance, service management, and systems delivery experience. You will need experience using data to power large-scale, cross-channel digital marketing and advertising campaigns and personalize customer experiences. You will need a creative approach to cultivating data partnerships and generating data opportunities when direct customer interaction and 1st party data is scarce. You will lead teams accountable for managing complex and scalable data across multiple technology platforms and services. This includes data platform capabilities built and operated in-house as well as third party services through vendor partnerships.

Responsibilities:
Define the Data Strategy to identify technical solutions and capability gaps against the roadmap of all TWDC data domains, based on the analysis of Company’s business goals, objectives and needs, and ensures alignment with other key technology functions
Lead the business case development for investments in data solutions for Studio in partnership with Studio Executives and alignment with broader companywide initiatives.
Provide strategic direction and oversee the integration of emerging Big Data platforms and tools for advanced analytics including machine learning/data science
Manage a team of approximately 30 consisting of product managers, project managers, engineers, programmer analysts, and database administrators.
Manage data vendor relationships and contracts on-behalf of Company Studios
Work with business partners to develop and/or evaluate business cases and align the architecture solution to meet stated business requirements strategic partnerships that span all lines of business and domains
Interface with other Company business unit data and analytics teams to align with and influence data governance, data management, data platforms, and data integration frameworks
Provide data management industry insight and guidance. Research, analyze and assess advanced and emerging technology solutions in multiple technology domains, anticipating the impact on architectures and systems
Educate and influence business leadership in the data management domain, articulating conceptual ideas and their impact to a widely divergent audience using excellent verbal, written, and listening skills
Enforce Company legal, privacy, and compliance requirements for data management
Interface with Company security teams to establish and maintain data standards and compliance
Basic Qualifications:
Demonstrated planning, change management, consulting and communication skills, analytical ability, negotiation and management skills
15+ years of experience in programming/systems analysis and business experience.
7+ years providing architectural direction to project development teams or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
5+ years of experience designing “big data” solutions and platforms with Hadoop and related capabilities, such as Snowflake, Qubole, Spark, Hive, Storm, Presto, Sqoop, Kafka, Hbase, SQL databases, and HDFS, preferably in a large-scale consumer focused industry
Technical experience with Advertising and Marketing Technology, including Marketing Automation, CRM systems, Data Management Platforms, Customer Data Platforms, 3 'rd party Ad Servers, and 3rd party data assets
Extensive experience in collecting and leveraging data within advertising and marketing technology platforms
Solid understanding of anonymous and known user identifiers in the ad/mar tech space, methods for interacting with walled gardens, and the technical limitations that apply
Proven experience in overall data management, data modeling, metadata management, master-data management and data movement.
Deep understanding of digital media, display, video, mobile, native advertising, the media planning and buying process, ad trafficking, and ad serving technologies
Understanding of privacy and legal implications of data collection in the digital space including GDPR, CCPA, VPPA, COPPA, and new and emerging legislation
Expertise in cloud computing and leveraging cloud capabilities within data platforms
Expertise regarding data architecture, data governance, data quality, ETL/ELT, Hadoop, Warehousing, Data Science and business intelligence tools, and techniques. Certifications a plus.
Experience with Python, Java, Scala or similar high level programming language.
Experienced with systems utilizing high volume and complex data processing, database platform selection and optimization, metadata management suites and OLAP technologies.
Must be a team player with demonstrated customer
Required Education
Bachelor’s degree, with equivalent work experience in MIS, Computer Science or related discipline. In-depth technical training
Preferred Education
Master’s degree, preferred.
Company Description: The Walt Disney Company is the global leader in high-quality entertainment and innovative technology. Begin a career that delivers unparalleled creative content and experiences to audiences around the world.

Job Description:
Position Overview

Company seeks Vice President, Data Management in Berkeley, CA to lead COMPANY 's effort to onboard, enhance, improve and widen look-through fund products and their usability across the company 's all Analytics Products (BarraOne, Barra Portfolio Manager, Risk Manager, Models Direct, FaCS, ESG Fund Metrics). Research and acquire in depth knowledge of the market data content models of upstream suppliers to COMPANY for all asset classes covered by the global security master with focus on all aspects and categories of fund instruments while having an excellent understanding of fixed income, equity, commodity futures and options, warrants, derivatives. Work with fund data providers and their products. Understand content model in the vendor 's native data schema and relate to business content objectives. In collaboration with the Business Group and Research and Development Groups, understand new reference data, portfolio data, fund look-through data requirements that enable clients to properly analyze new or existing financial instruments modeled in the COMPANY 's Analytics Products. Develop business logic required to integrate upstream data feeds to a normalized set of terms and conditions data models. Work closely with Data Content Solutions (DCS) development team in the implementation and maintenance of these business rules. Assist the development of derived data sets that are largely dependent on terms & conditions fund data and market data. Work with the Research group on vetting analytic models with an eye toward the proper application and usage of market data content. Maintain, re-engineer, and develop efficient and elegant processes to support the daily production of fund look-through data. Use COMPANY 's industry-leading risk management applications to investigate client questions and issues and assess data quality and turn those findings into enhancement opportunities.

Specific Knowledge/Skills

REQUIREMENTS: Master 's degree or foreign equivalent in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field and three (3) years of experience in job offered or occupation: managing market data content including equities, equity derivatives, mutual funds, fixed income, government and corporate debt, structured debt, commodity futures, commodity derivatives, and credit derivatives; working with legal entity data and data models; working with vendor market data architectures and projects; programming utilizing Visual Basic, Python, Perl, and C or C++; utilizing relational databases including MS SQL and Oracle; working with large vendor market data architectures and products, including Reuters Triarch/RDF, Reuters Datascope Equities, Onsite Fixed Income EJV, S&P Compustat/Research Insight; and utilizing Brinson performance attribution and multiperiod aggregation of performance attribution based on risk factors. In the alternative, the employer will accept a Bachelor 's degree in the above listed fields and five (5) years of progressively responsible experience in the above listed skills.

Company is looking for an innovative, hands-on, customer-obsessed Vice President of Product for the Digital and Direct-to-Consumer business for Magnolia, a joint venture partnership between Company, Inc. and a Chip and Jo Gaines. In this role you will lead the launch and ongoing development of new digital and direct-to-consumer products, including websites and applications across popular platforms, such as Apple, Android, Amazon, Roku, and others. You will be a strategic partner to Magnolia leadership to improve the lives of Magnolia customers through new products across mobile, tablets, web, connected TVs, voice, and other emerging technologies. As the VP, Product you will combine the inspiration of the Magnolia brand with a data-driven approach to bring to life compelling experiences that delight customers and increase engagement. You will lead the creation of products that solve practical problems for customers, while inspiring them and improving their everyday lives.
The VP, Product will lead the design, creation, and ongoing improvement of new digital and direct-to-consumer products for Magnolia. They will lead product planning and prioritization, user research, and the user experience design necessary to deliver product features that increase engagement, delight customers, and create passionate and loyal fans. They will lead effective product development processes that starts with the customer. They will develop innovative product features, implement scalable ecommerce solutions, and ensure an end-to-end world class product experience. They will work with engineering leaders to prioritize, build, and enhance key features. They will establish operating processes to drive systematic improvements to the product based on customer feedback, needs, and behavior.
An ideal candidate will be excited about the Magnolia brand and what Chip and Jo Gaines’s vision can deliver for customers. They will have a successful track record of owning and driving a complex product portfolio, have proven leadership experience in managing large customer-facing projects and bring relevant insights in technology. They will be a creative problem-solver and sought-out decision maker with insatiable curiosity. They are a leader that teams love to work with because they inspire, develop, and care for their team members. They build trust with people from all areas of the business and have a proven track record of delivering products that customers love. This leader takes end-to-end ownership and consistently delivers results in a fast-paced environment.
Responsibilities
1. Customer Empathy: Exhibit passion and deep understanding to prioritize and meet the needs of Magnolia customers. Be the voice of the customer, understand their ongoing needs, and be accountable for delivery against those needs.
2. Product Vision: Establish a customer-centric vision for Magnolia digital and direct-to-consumer products with the Magnolia leadership team that meets key customer needs and delivers compelling experiences. Build trust and inspire teams to align around a common vision that delivers on long-term product and business strategy.
3. Leadership: Set direction for the product team, evangelizing a clear vision for success and guide teams to impact. Attract, develop, and motivate an expert team of product managers, helping them enhance their skills and grow their careers. Build an innovative and disciplined team culture that builds trust, encourages collaborations, maintains strong accountability, delivers results, increases employee engagement, and has fun.
4. Collaborate & Partner: Be a highly respected senior partner and thought leader, working skillfully across teams and functions to deliver world-class digital and direct to consumer products - including business, design, engineering, data science, content and marketing leaders.
5. Build for Scale: Create and deliver solutions, processes and mechanisms to build for scale and ensure products meet customer needs.
Requirements
* Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering or relevant field
* 7+ years’ work experience in product management job function in technology, ecommerce, media, or relevant industries
* Experience leading and growing product management teams
* Experience working with a cross-functional team across engineering, design, business, and marketing
* Experience leading product development from start to finish, including shipping customer-facing products and driving alignment around a vision and priorities
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
* Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering or relevant field
* Must have the legal right to work in the United States
Preferred Qualifications
* Excellent track record of product leadership and shaping business strategy for customer facing products
* Experience leading complex digital and direct to consumer products through multiple lifecycles
* Experience navigating through ambiguous problems, especially where the product strategy, roadmap and technology approach may not be known or defined
* Experience removing roadblocks, making complex tradeoffs and high judgement decisions, managing risk and shipping on time
* Experience fully utilizing the competencies of engineering, design, and business teams
* Comfortable working in a fast-changing environment where continuous innovation is desired
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to use data and metrics to inform priorities and tradeoffs, solve complex problems and develop business cases
* High attention to detail and demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously
* Proven track record of taking ownership, doing what’s necessary and driving results
* Master’s degree in business, technical or related field

Company is reinventing the traditional real estate process to create a radically different experience.We level the playing field by giving any qualified buyer the chance to make a cash offer. We eliminate risk and uncertainty for homeowners trying to buy a new home with our Trade Up program. We streamline the homebuying process by unifying brokerage, financing, closing, and home services. Innovation is in our DNA. What will you create here
When you join Company, you will have the ability to not only affect change across an industry, but on a human level. Real estate and technology are what we do, but people are at the core of our mission. From client-facing roles to data and technology, we start and end with the people we work with because they’re what matters. You’ll work alongside others who love to solve problems, think creatively, and take risks to fly the plane as we continue to build it! If this sounds appealing, we want to connect with you.
As the VP of Product you’ll build a team of deeply empathetic and passionate individuals to reimagine home ownership. You’ll build upon your knowledge of strategy, product management, analytics, design & operations to chart a path that continues to set Company apart. You’re an empowering leader who brings people together and enables your team to create truly incredible client experiences while delivering value for our business.
What You’ll Do:
Guide the strategic planning of our products and initiatives to deliver uniquely Company experiences with other leaders at the company.
Drive roadmapping, prioritization and execution throughout the product lifecycle to ensure delivery of awesome products that our customers love and our employees value.
Leverage data every day, building a culture that not only embraces data driven decision making but creates unique value and insight in our products through a deep understanding of how to apply data to everyday problems.
Build a team of amazing Product Managers and Designers, fostering a culture that your team thrives in and enables each member to deliver impactful contributions.
Effectively build a winning together culture across Company and the industry, partnering with our Developer, Data Science, Marketing, Sales and Operations teams and identifying opportunities for partnerships across the industry.
What You’ll Bring:
10+ years of relevant Product Management and leadership experience and a track record of success and learnings.
A deep rooted sense of customer empathy.
A strong focus on customer experience, strategy, analytics, and machine learning
An eagerness to learn and build new skills
Experience in real estate, capital markets and financial products is a plus
Your Superpowers
Customer Focus: You possess a passionate drive to innovate and offer unique solutions that meet or exceed expectations. You are adept at relationship management.
Critical Thinking: You employ a thoughtful process of analyzing data and problem solving to reach well-reasoned solutions.
Collaborative: You partner effectively with customers and colleagues, to drive our ‘winning together’ culture and execute on our common goals.
Communicative: You have impeccable written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey messaging to diverse audiences. You utilize active listening skills and ensure that customers and colleagues feel heard.
Learning Agility: You are open to new ways of thinking and committed to acquiring new skills to retain a competitive advantage.
Driven: You take initiative and persist in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks. You are organized, focused and highly disciplined. Hard work doesn’t scare you.
Accountability: You accept responsibility for your own actions and decisions and demonstrate commitment to accomplishing work in an ethical, compliant, and efficient manner for the benefit of your clients and the company.
Work Excellence: You are conscientious with the consistency and quality of deliverables. You’re adept at prioritization and project management with attentiveness to detail and consistent follow through.
Flexibility: You thrive in a dynamic, fluid and unstructured environment because you are a self-starter who is eager to learn, grow and build something great together.

Company is a modern marketing company engineered to meet the unprecedented challenges and opportunities facing marketers today. We are setting a new standard by delivering clients the most advanced, end-to-end solutions they need, in the most efficient, effective and transparent ways. Anchored by two decades of groundbreaking market research and data science, we provide brands with consumer intelligence, strategy, media planning and buying, and renowned creative in all media, producing some of the most innovative, cutting-edge work in culture today. With offices in New York, Los Angeles, Boston, Austin, Seattle and San Francisco, we are more than 200 people, a community of extraordinary talent, working as one team to help our clients win. 
Company Science helps brands and publishers create and implement high impact data strategies, including shaping business strategy, designing scalable data architectures, building machine learning models and optimization frameworks, and delivering scalable back end and front end software platforms. We are looking for a Vice President, Data Consulting to help lead these engagements, working alongside our data scientists and data engineers.
 Your responsibilities would include:
Day to day leadership of execution teams that include PhD Data Scientists and Software Engineers
Advising clients on the strategic application of data and data science to their business
Formulating overall project approach and shaping final recommendations
Serving as main Point of Contact for the client of the project; meeting with them regularly
Ensure plans and deliverables match clients business need and strategy
Ensure work meets our high standards and delivers high impact for client
Leading 2 – 3 projects simultaneously
Will work with Data Scientists closely
Acts as a role model within the company, playing an active role coaching staff
Helping to sell new projects, scoping and creating proposals
The ideal candidate would have:
Several years of experience in consulting, ideally on projects involving data & analytics
Robust analytical skills
Excellent presentation and communication skills
Strong project management skills
Knowledgeable about data & data science, but not necessarily a data scientist
Advanced degree, such as an MBA. Undergraduate studies in a technical field
Comfortable handling ambiguity and moving a project from inception to successful conclusion
Willingness to travel and work in new cities

About the Role:

Company is looking for an enthusiastic, analytical and skillful Vice President of Marketing to lead our award-winning marketing team. In this role, you will lead our B2B marketing strategy. You will have the ability to both think strategically and act tactically on your team. Some examples of work include architecting and executing campaigns, programs, events, materials and thought leadership to drive advertiser demand for our business. Overview

The VP, Strategic Planning and Analysis will be responsible for leading both short and long-term financial planning and analysis, the development of operational Key Performance Indicators (KPI), variance reporting and business analyses, and provides analysis to improve the financial performance for Company, Company, and several other product lines. This highly visible role includes frequent interaction with the Company Executive Team and requires close coordination with Corporate Finance to update quarterly forecasts and conduct analysis of business performance.

The VP, Strategic Planning and Analysis is a self-starter, who is able to work effectively, autonomously and drive strategy and effective decision making with the Company and our Company teams as well as cross-functionally with Company corporate Marketing, Product Management, Finance, Data Science & Engineering teams.  The ideal individual will develop a strong understanding of how Company and Company strategies are evolving and how the organization should evolve to get ahead of those changes. While the primary scope will focus on Company and Company, the Vice President must demonstrate the ability to think holistically for Company, including impact and ripples for Company’s other brands and product lines.
